title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 13 ยง 97.12 - Record
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 13 ยง 97.12 - Record

State Regulations
(a) The hearing officer shall make a complete
record of the proceeding by whatever means he or she deems appropriate, including but not limited to, stenographic transcription or recording
devices. (b) The record shall include: (1)
records and documents in the

Attorney General's possession relevant to the initial findings under article 7-A; (2)
notices, pleadings, motions and all rulings by the hearing officer; (3)
evidence presented; (4)
questions, offers of proof and objections; (5)
findings of fact and
conclusions of law; and
(6)
the decision or determination. (c) If requested, the Attorney General shall prepare the record and any transcript of the proceedings within a
reasonable time after the decision, but before the commencement of time for judicial review, and provide a copy to any party. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 13
ยง
97.12

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
